content.question: Which of the following limits does not yield an indeterminate form?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 0, of, the fraction with numerator 4 times x cubed, and denominator cosine x, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, the fraction with numerator the natural log of the fraction x over 3, and denominator x squared, minus 7 x, plus 12, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches pi, of, the fraction with numerator pi minus x, and denominator the sine of, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches infinity, of, the fraction with numerator x to the tenth power, and denominator e raised to the 2 x power, plus x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches pi, of, the fraction with numerator pi minus x, and denominator the sine of, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

topic.text: 4.7: Using L'Hospital's Rule for Determining Limits of Indeterminate Forms

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
